text.text_translated:
In the 1950s, banana companies in Central America had a big problem. Their `Gros Michel banana` was dying. This banana was the product that made them the most money. People called it Big Mike.

Now, the same problem is happening again. It is happening to the `Cavendish` banana. The `Cavendish` banana came after Big Mike. It was Big Mike's successor.

The `Gros Michel banana` was a fruit. It was easy to move. It had thick skin and tasted sweet. This banana was the main one on many big farms in Central America.

United Fruit was a big company. It was the main company for bananas in South America. It grew bananas. It also sent them to other countries. This company grew many bananas. They did it in the best and fastest way. They cloned shoots from the plant stems. This means they made exact copies. They did not grow them from seeds. They grew the plants in fields. The plants were very close together.
